item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 6:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. My 16-month theanine self-experiment (116 points | 57 comments)
2. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (174 points | 47 comments)
3. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (148 points | 28 comments)
4. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (450 points | 161 comments)
5. Posthog/.cursorrules (14 points | 1 comment)
6. Building an open-source Wi-Fi Mac layer for the ESP32 (33 points | 7 comments)
7. Roald Dahl on the death of his daughter (2015) (72 points | 10 comments)
8. Unseen photos of U2 and The Smiths released as Maxwell Hall Archive is unveiled (10 points | discuss)
9. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (96 points | 50 comments)
10. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (273 points | 465 comments)
11. Volkswagen reintroducing physical controls for vital functions (374 points | 245 comments)
12. How much traffic can a pre-rendered Next.js site handle? (22 points | 9 comments)
13. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (149 points | 44 comments)
14. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (93 points | 45 comments)
15. Ten Digit Problems (2011) [pdf] (17 points | discuss)
16. Discworld Rules (192 points | 241 comments)
17. Show HN: TypeLeap: LLM Powered Reactive Intent UI/UX (48 points | 19 comments)
18. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (111 points | 34 comments)
19. Social Media Posts About Medical Tests with Potential for Overdiagnosis (27 points | 15 comments)
20. Time for a Change: The long, contentious history of time shifts (27 points | 28 comments)
21. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (61 points | 3 comments)
22. OneText (YC W23) is hiring a browser extension engineer ( | hide)
23. The program is the database is the interface (153 points | 48 comments)
24. Body Doubling (96 points | 69 comments)
25. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (96 points | 27 comments)
26. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (670 points | 259 comments)
27. You might not need Redis (173 points | 113 comments)
28. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (305 points | 167 comments)
29. An epic treatise on error models for systems programming languages (204 points | 65 comments)
30. MCP vs. API Explained (114 points | 73 comments)
